attributes.action: Maintain A Supply Of Analogue Utility Meters, as an alternative to Smart Meters
attributes.additional_details:
In light of the recent backlash against the Energy Bill, due to a perception that it would mandate smart meters, and the governments subsequent reassurance that it won't:
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-9865/

A level of production of analogue utility meters needs to be maintained so as to avoid an eventual 'mandation' of smart meters through obsolescence of alternatives.
attributes.background:
Some people don't wish to have smart meters installed for several reasons including privacy and health concerns.

We ask the government ensure that a level of analogue utility meters remains in production, to meet the ongoing demand of those wishing to not have smart meters installed.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the supply of utility meters are a matter for manufacturers and utility providers, not the UK Government or Parliament.
